intro: Vincetoxicum japonicum, commonly known as Japanese glorybower, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has opposite, simple leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. It produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which can be harmful to livestock and humans. Vincetoxicum japonicum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
